summary: The conversation revolves around the timeline for solving the problem of autonomous driving. The speakers acknowledge that predicting a timeline is challenging since no one has created fully autonomous driving before. Some aspects of the problem are easier than others, and it is difficult to forecast progress accurately. The speakers discuss the tendency of car companies and individuals to make predictions and then backtrack on them. The leader of the conversation mentions their belief that the problem of autonomous driving is tractable and that their team at Tesla is on track to achieving it. They discuss the formation of intuition and belief through studying, analyzing data, and spending time thinking about the problem. The conversation also touches on the many human factors involved in autonomous driving, such as pedestrian behavior, eye contact, and driving at night. The progress made at Tesla in the past five years is also highlighted, with the system going from barely keeping the lane on the highway to becoming more competent. Despite remaining challenges, the speakers maintain their belief in the fundamental components being in place to solve the problem, including data engines, onboard computers, and training processes.
